This is a copy of the quarterly report supplement sent to affected OEMs for the safety campaign on certain Cummins L9 engines. The remote fuel filter hoses installed on the subject engines can become separated from the fuel fitting resulting in fuel leaks and lack of fuel supply to the engine. A fuel hose that becomes disconnected will result in an engine stall, increasing the risk of a crash. A fuel leak in the presence of an ignition source may increase the risk of a fire.

A fuel hose that becomes disconnected will result in an engine stall, increasing the risk of a crash. A fuel leak in the presence of an ignition source may increase the risk of a fire.

Dealer work instructions

We have contacted via multi channel our customers and dealers and asked to return product to us on February 24, 2025. We are offering our clients a spare part and cover the cost for car transportation to workshop and removal works. MEYLE will cover all costs for the inspection, replacement of the control arms and subframe, towing and rental car, as well as the shipping costs for replaced and uninstalled parts. The costs are reimbursed via the relevant dealers.

This is a copy of the field action safety campaign to remedy certain high voltage battery packs used in certain Accelera by Cummins PowerDrive 7000 electric drivetrains. According to the supplier, pieces of the fastener hardware internal to the High Voltage Battery may become detached because of inadequate manufacturing process control at the supplier. Broken pieces may become debris and potentially cause an internal short circuit. An internal short circuit may lead to a partial battery fire and activate the Thermal Runaway Detection (TRD) warning, which would open the High Voltage Battery contactors. This may cause a sudden loss of motive power without warning, increasing the risk of a crash.

Harley-Davidson has learned that installation of certain accessory kits on certain Model Year 2023  2025 Touring and CVO Touring motorcycles may take these vehicles out of compliance with Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard No. 108, Lamps, reflective devices, and associated equipment. Specifically, the lower fairings may partially obstruct visibility of the front, side reflector if paired with inverted forks on the same vehicle.

Harley-Davidson has learned that installation of certain accessory kits on certain Model Year 2023  2025 Touring and CVO Touring motorcycles may take these vehicles out of compliance with Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard/Canadian Motor Vehicle Safety Standard No. 108, Lamps, reflective devices, and associated equipment and similar worldwide regulations. Specifically, the lower fairings may partially obstruct visibility of the front, side reflector if paired with inverted forks on the same vehicle.

Owner notification letter for Recall 25T002 advises purchasers of Dunlop Sportmax GPR 300F motorcycle tires, size 110/70R17M/C 54H (DOT TIN 1EU WA YAYM 3924), may not comply with FMVSS 119 S6.1.2(a) due to a potential for inner liner bulging near the belt edge. Instructions are provided to owners to identify and replace the affected units at no cost to the owners.

This recall notice (Recall No. 25T002) from Sumitomo Rubber North America, Inc. informs dealers/retailers that certain Dunlop Sportmax GPR 300F motorcycle tires (size 110/70R17M/C 54H), manufactured in production week 3924 (DOT TIN: 1EU WA YAYM 3924), may not comply with FMVSS 119 S6.1.2(a) due to a potential for inner liner bulging near the belt edge. The notice requires all dealers to immediately stop the sale of all affected inventory and return any affected tires to the manufacturer for replacement at no charge. Further, the notice requires dealers to inspect and replace any affected tires at no charge for customers/owners who visit the dealer with an affected product. Dealers are also directed to render all affected tires permanently unserviceable. Finally, dealers are directed to provide the customer names, addresses and other relevant information about sales of the affected tires to facilitate direct recall notification to be issued to the customers.

Certain Cooper Discoverer Stronghold AT tires, size LT275/65R18 LRE, from week 0525, may have been manufactured with the date code portion of the tire identification number (TIN) not meeting the regulatory requirement to show week and year. The subject non-compliant tires were produced with a blank slug installed in the Tire Identification Number (TIN) in place of the required week and year code (0525), as required per FMVSS 574.

Mailed Interim US Customer Letter Redacted. Mailed 2/24/2025

Safety Recall
Parts and procedures are now available.

All affected chassis must have a date inspection performed on the throttle pedal assembly. Pedal assemblies that fall within the suspect date range must be replaced. See procedures for more information.

Certain vehicles may have an oversized magnet carrier in the throttle pedal assembly. The magnet carrier acts as the pivot for the throttle pedal. An oversized magnet carrier may cause the throttle pedal to stick.

If the throttle pedal fails to return to idle, or sticks, it may increase the risk of a crash.

Drivers may feel sticking or that the pedal doesnt return to idle once released. Pressing the service brake will overcome a stuck throttle pedal and allow the vehicle to stop.

Certain vehicles may have an oversized magnet carrier in the throttle pedal assembly. The magnet carrier acts as the pivot for the throttle pedal. An oversized magnet carrier may cause the throttle pedal to stick.

If the throttle pedal fails to return to idle, or sticks, it may increase the risk of a crash.

Drivers may feel sticking or that the pedal doesnt return to idle once released. Pressing the service brake will overcome a stuck throttle pedal and allow the vehicle to stop.

This bulletin will be updated when parts and procedures are available.

Certain vehicles may have an oversized magnet carrier in the throttle pedal assembly. The magnet carrier acts as the pivot for the throttle pedal. An oversized magnet carrier may cause the throttle pedal to stick.

If the throttle pedal fails to return to idle, or sticks, it may increase the risk of a crash.

Drivers may feel sticking or that the pedal doesnt return to idle once released. Pressing the service brake will overcome a stuck throttle pedal and allow the vehicle to stop.

This bulletin will be updated when parts and procedures are available.

This notice is sent to you in accordance with the National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act.
Kenworth Truck Company has decided that a defect, which relates to motor vehicle safety, exists in certain Vehicle Model Years 2023-2024 T180/T280/T380/T480 chassis manufactured from 8/18/2022 through 5/8/2023.
Certain vehicles may have an oversized magnet carrier in the throttle pedal assembly. The magnet carrier acts as the pivot for the throttle pedal. An oversized magnet carrier may cause the throttle pedal to stick. If the throttle pedal fails to return to idle, or sticks, it may increase the risk of a crash. 
The driver may feel sticking or observe that the pedal doesnt return to idle once released. Pressing the service brake will overcome a stuck throttle pedal and allow the vehicle to stop.
Kenworth has initiated a recall in cooperation with Orscheln to remedy the defect. This repair should take approximately 1 hour and will be performed at no charge to you. Please contact your Kenworth dealer immediately to schedule an appointment for this repair. You can find your nearest Kenworth dealer using the Dealer Locator on our website www.Kenworth.com or by scanning the QR code on this letter.

If the throttle pedal fails to return to idle, or sticks, it may increase the risk of a crash.

Drivers may feel sticking or that the pedal doesnt return to idle once released. Pressing the service brake will overcome a stuck throttle pedal and allow the vehicle to stop.

This notice is sent to you in accordance with the National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act.
Kenworth Truck Company has decided that a defect, which relates to motor vehicle safety, exists in certain Vehicle Model Years 2023-2024 T180/T280/T380/T480 chassis manufactured from 8/18/2022 through 5/8/2023.

An oversized magnet carrier may cause the throttle pedal to stick. If the throttle pedal fails to return to idle, or sticks, it may increase the risk of a crash. 
The driver may feel sticking or observe that the pedal doesnt return to idle once released. Pressing the service brake will overcome a stuck throttle pedal and allow the vehicle to stop.
Kenworth has initiated a recall in cooperation with Orscheln to remedy the defect. This repair should take approximately 1 hour and will be performed at no charge to you. Please contact your Kenworth dealer immediately to schedule an appointment for this repair. You can find your nearest Kenworth dealer using the Dealer Locator on our website www.Kenworth.com or by scanning the QR code on this letter.

A concern has been identified on certain vehicles, where the rear-view camera image display may
become intermittent or permanently fail as a result of wiring damage in the trunk. A revised
harness and overlay is required
SAFETY RECALL 25V017 (H535) INTERIM OWNER LETTER

A concern has been identified on certain 19MY and 20MY Jaguar XE vehicles, where the rear view camera image display may become intermittent or permanently fail as a result of wiring damage in the trunk.
Lack of, or intermittent, display of the rear view camera image may result in the driver being unaware of objects or pedestrians behind the vehicle increasing the risk of a crash.

During assembly, the passenger-side front stabilizer bar bracket bolts may have been improperly fastened. If the bracket bolt(s) loosens and separates from the vehicle frame, the stabilizer bar and/or bracket can damage the high voltage cables and/or EV battery coolant lines.

During assembly, the passenger-side front stabilizer bar bracket bolts may have been improperly fastened. If the bracket bolt(s) loosens and separates from the vehicle frame, the stabilizer bar and/or bracket can damage the high voltage cables and/or EV battery coolant lines.

Owner Notification Letter - The passenger-side front stabilizer bar bracket bolts may have been improperly torqued during assembly. If the bolt(s) loosen and fall off, the stabilizer bar and/or bracket could damage adjacent high voltage cables and EV battery coolant lines, causing the vehicle to become undriveable and increase the risk of a crash or injury.

The Dealer Principal letter is to notify the dealer principal of a safety defect relating to the  Floor Harness Inspection in certain 2023-2025 MY Niro EV, Niro HEV, and Niro PHEV vehicles, the details of the recall campaign, owner notification schedule, and to remind them that it is a violation of Federal law for them to sell or lease a vehicle covered by the notification until the recall has been performed on the vehicle.The Dealer Principal letter is to notify the dealer principal of a safety defect relating to the  Floor Harness Inspection in certain 2023-2025 MY Niro EV, Niro HEV, and Niro PHEV vehicles, the details of the recall campaign, owner notification schedule, and to remind them that it is a violation of Federal law for them to sell or lease a vehicle covered by the notification until the recall has been performed on the vehicle.
The Q&A contains questions and answers regarding the Floor Harness Inspection in certain 2023-2025 MY Niro EV, Niro HEV, and Niro PHEV vehicles.
The Technical Service Bulletin (TSB) lists specific repair instructions relating to the Floor Harness Inspection and Protective Covering Installation.

The Dealer Hold Notice is to notify the dealers of a safety defect relating to the floor wiring harness in certain 2023-2025 MY Niro EV, Niro HEV & Niro PHEV vehicles, the details of the recall campaign, planned repair availability and planned owner notification schedule, and to remind them that it is a violation of Federal law for them to sell or lease a vehicle covered by the notification until the recall has been performed on the vehicle.

The Dealer Parts & Service Manager letter is to notify the dealer of a safety defect relating to the Floor Harness Inspection in certain 2023-2025 MY Niro EV, Niro HEV, and Niro PHEV vehicles, the details of the recall campaign, owner notification schedule, and to remind them that it is a violation of Federal law for them to sell or lease a vehicle covered by the notification until the recall has been performed on the vehicle.

Owner Letter notifies the customer of the safety recall campaign relating to the Floor Wiring Assembly what the concern is, what Kia will do, and what the customer should do when they receive the notice. It will also advise them of the steps to take to submit documents for review of possible reimbursement if they have had previous repairs for the recalled part.

The air volume calculation for system air on certain Mack models may be below the 12 times combined volume of all service brake chambers, as required per the FMVSS 49 CFR571.121. The risk is a vehicle crash that may result in personal injury.

25TA01 - Dealer Letter - The subject vehicles are equipped with a low-pressure fuel pump which may stop operating. If this were to occur, warning lights and messages may be displayed on the instrument panel, and the engine may run rough. This may result in a vehicle stall, and the vehicle may be unable to be restarted. If a vehicle stall occurs while driving at higher speeds, this could increase the risk of a crash.

Owner Notification Letter - Certain control settings in the fuel injection electronic control unit (FI-ECU) were improperly programmed, potentially causing the engine to lose drive power, hesitate,
and/or stall in certain driving conditions.
Safety Consequence
If the engine loses drive power, hesitates, and/or stalls, the risk of a crash or injury are
increased.
Emission Consequence
Your vehicle may also be equipped with an improperly functioning on-board
emission-related diagnostic system that violates California and Federal standards and
regulations.

Due to improper programming of the fuel injection electronic control unit (FI-ECU) settings, sudden changes in the throttle opening could cause the MIL (DTC P061B) to illuminate and/or the engine to lose drive power, hesitate and/or stall.

Due to improper software programming, the center information display unit may show a black screen after the transmission is shifted from reverse to other drive positions within a certain time. If the transmission is shifted into reverse following this display error, the screen remains black. If a black screen is shown in the center information display unit when the vehicle is driven in reverse, the risk of a crash or injury are increased.

NHTSA ID 25V033

Subaru ID WRB-25 Incorrect Wheel Lug Seat Surface
Subaru of America, Inc. (Subaru) has initiated a safety recall for certain 2025 model year Forester Limited vehicles equipped with 18-inch aluminum alloy wheels. 

Description of the Defect and Safety Risk
The affected vehicles may be equipped with 18-inch aluminum alloy wheels manufactured with an incorrectly specified lug seat surface. The incorrectly specified lug seat surface could affect vehicle stability, increasing the risk of a crash.

Remedy
For all potentially affected vehicles, Subaru retailers will inspect all four wheels and replace any wheel(s) found to have an incorrectly specified lug seat surface with correctly manufactured one(s)

The affected vehicles may not have been correctly inspected in a prior recall to determine if a replacement of the spiral cable assembly in the steering column that controls the drivers side airbag was needed. A loose connection in the spiral cable can cause the airbag warning light to illuminate, and the drivers airbag may not deploy in a crash. As a result, the vehicle will not comply with a federal safety standard and may increase the risk of injury to the driver in the event of a crash.

Introduction
The Exterior Lighting Switch (ELS) in certain T180/T280/T380/T480 chassis may not function and can be reset only by a key cycle. This issue may result in non-compliance with the following US Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standards (FMVSS) or Canadian Motor Vehicle Safety Standards (CMVSS) Regulations:

FMVSS 101 - Controls and Displays
FMVSS 108 - Lamps, Reflective Devices, and Associated Equipment
CMVSS 101  Controls, Tell-tales, Indicators, and Sources of Illumination
CMVSS 108 - Lamps, Reflective Devices, and Associated Equipment.
If the ELS fails, the hazard lights and the backlight brightness adjustment may not function. As a result, the lack of hazard lights may not alert other drivers. Failure to adjust the backlight brightness may distract the operator or make it difficult to see critical safety information, which may increase the risk of a crash.

Warning Which Can Precede or Occur: None

This notice is sent to you in accordance with the National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act.

Kenworth Truck Company has decided that certain Vehicle Model Year 2023-2026 T180 / T280 / T380 / T480 chassis built from 7/5/2022 through 12/20/2024 fail to conform to Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard No. 101, Controls and Displays and No. 108, Lamps, Reflective Devices, and Associated Equipment.
The Exterior Lighting Switch (ELS) in certain vehicles may not function. It is non-responsive and can be reset only by a key cycle. If the ELS fails, the hazard lights and the backlight brightness adjustment may not function. As a result, the lack of hazard lights may not alert other drivers. Failure to adjust the backlight brightness may distract the operator or make it difficult to see critical safety information, which may increase the risk of a crash. No warning precedes this condition.
Kenworth has initiated a recall to update vehicle software. This repair should take approximately 1 hour and will be performed at no charge to you. Please contact your Kenworth dealer immediately to schedule an appointment for this repair. You can find your nearest Kenworth dealer using the Dealer Locator on our website www.Kenworth.com or by scanning the QR code on this letter.

Introduction
The Exterior Lighting Switch (ELS) in certain T180/T280/T380/T480 chassis may not function and can be reset only by a key cycle. This issue may result in non-compliance with the following US Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standards (FMVSS) or Canadian Motor Vehicle Safety Standards (CMVSS) Regulations:

FMVSS 101 - Controls and Displays
FMVSS 108 - Lamps, Reflective Devices, and Associated Equipment
CMVSS 101  Controls, Tell-tales, Indicators, and Sources of Illumination
CMVSS 108 - Lamps, Reflective Devices, and Associated Equipment.
If the ELS fails, the hazard lights and the backlight brightness adjustment may not function. As a result, the lack of hazard lights may not alert other drivers. Failure to adjust the backlight brightness may distract the operator or make it difficult to see critical safety information, which may increase the risk of a crash.

The Exterior Lighting Switch (ELS) in certain T180/T280/T380/T480 chassis may not function and can be reset only by a key cycle. This issue may result in non-compliance with FMVSS/CMVSS 101 and 108.

Affected chassis must have the Vehicle Software updated.


Introduction
The Exterior Lighting Switch (ELS) in certain T180/T280/T380/T480 chassis may not function and can be reset only by a key cycle. This issue may result in non-compliance with the following US Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standards (FMVSS) or Canadian Motor Vehicle Safety Standards (CMVSS) Regulations:

FMVSS 101 - Controls and Displays
FMVSS 108 - Lamps, Reflective Devices, and Associated Equipment
CMVSS 101  Controls, Tell-tales, Indicators, and Sources of Illumination
CMVSS 108 - Lamps, Reflective Devices, and Associated Equipment.
If the ELS fails, the hazard lights and the backlight brightness adjustment may not function. As a result, the lack of hazard lights may not alert other drivers. Failure to adjust the backlight brightness may distract the operator or make it difficult to see critical safety information, which may increase the risk of a crash.

Warning Which Can Precede or Occur: None

This bulletin will be updated when software and programming procedures are available.

Letter to owner's of a vehicle that has a safety recall notifying them of said recall. The letter describes the defect and why it is being recalled. It describes what VM will do, what the owner should do, what customers who no longer own the vehicle should do and contact information for VM and NHTSA if they have questions.
Work instructions for dealers and repair shops.

Vantage Mobility (VM) is recalling certain Toyota Sienna Rear Entry minivans (manufactured between 12/18/2023 and 12/4/2024) under NHTSA Recall Number 25V-062 due to a potential defect in the rear axle trailing arm mounts, which may crack or separate under extreme driving conditions, increasing the risk of loss of control and crashes.

Dealer Instructions:

Owners will be notified by mail starting 2/25/2025 and should contact their local VM dealer for a free repair.
Dealers with inventory must report affected VINs to VM and request upgrade kits.
Repair includes installing a bolt-on upgrade kit and a 4-wheel alignment (approx. 3+ hours).
If a failed weld is found, dealers must halt repairs and contact VM for further instructions.
It is illegal to sell, lease, or ship affected vehicles until the recall is completed.
For questions, dealers should contact VM at (800) 488-9082 or Recall@vantagemobility.com.

The rear floor wiring harness in the subject vehicles may have been produced with insufficient crimping at the rear side airbag connector terminal(s), increasing the risk of an open circuit. An open circuit could impede the deployment signal in the affected connector.
A rear side airbag non-deployment may increase the risk of injury to occupants during crashes warranting commanded deployment of the Supplemental Restraint System (SRS)

Certain 2025MY IONIQ 5 (NEA EV) vehicles rear floor wiring harness may have been produced with insufficient crimping at the rear side airbag connector terminal(s), increasing the risk of an open circuit. An open circuit could impede the deployment signal in the affected connector. Diagnostic Trouble Codes (DTCs) B142900 and/or B143300 and the airbag light may also appear. A rear side airbag non-deployment may increase the risk of injury to occupants during crashes warranting commanded deployment of the Supplemental Restraint System (SRS). This bulletin outlines the procedure to inspect the terminals of the floor harness for improper crimping and if necessary, replace the rear floor wiring harness.

The rear floor wiring harness may have been produced with insufficient crimping at the rear side airbag connector terminal(s), increasing the risk of an open circuit. An open circuit could trigger an illumination of the air bag warning lamp and prevent the deployment signal in the vehicles Supplemental Restraint System (SRS). A rear side airbag non-deployment may increase the risk of injury to occupants during crashes warranting commanded deployment of the SRS.

The subject vehicles are equipped with an LFB feature designed for use on performance roadways, such as racetracks. LFB allows operators to control vehicle speed through simultaneous operation of both the accelerator and brake pedals. When the LFB is engaged, the Integrated Electronic Brake (IEB) control software may trigger depressurization of the Anti-Lock Brake System (ABS) pump, resulting in reduced braking performance. Reduced braking performance could increase the distance required to stop, increasing the risk of a crash.

The subject vehicles are equipped with a Left-Foot Braking (LFB) feature designed for use on performance roadways, such as racetracks.  LFB allows operators to control vehicle speed through simultaneous operation of both the accelerator and brake pedals.  During certain driving maneuvers with LFB engaged, the Integrated Electronic Brake (IEB) control software may trigger depressurization of the ABS system, resulting in reduced braking performance.

We are calling to let you know to let you know there have been complications reported related to the Vehicle Control Unit (VCU) software that may cause momentary continued acceleration during the release of the accelerator pedal while the vehicles N e-shift feature is engaged, increasing the risk of a crash. Our records indicate that your vehicle, VIN XXXXXXXX, has had this software update installed as the remedy for recall 275. Hyundai is currently investigating the root cause of this complication and will provide an update when available. In the meantime, Hyundai recommends all owners who previously received remedy repair for recall 275 NOT TO USE the N e-SHIFT Feature. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused.

There have been complications reported related to the VCU software that may cause momentary continued acceleration during the release of the accelerator pedal while the vehicles N e-shift feature is engaged, increasing the risk of a crash.

Certain 2025MY IONIQ 5 N (NE EV N) are equipped with a Left-Foot Braking (LFB) feature designed for use on performance roadways, such as racetracks. LFB allows operators to control vehicle speed through simultaneous operation of both the accelerator and brake pedals. During certain driving maneuvers with LFB engaged, the Integrated Electronic Brake (IEB) control software may trigger depressurization of the ABS system, resulting in reduced braking performance.
Reduced braking performance could lead to longer stopping distances than anticipated by the operator, increasing the risk of a crash. Follow the procedure in this TSB to update the software for both the IEB (ABSESC) and Vehicle Control Unit (VCU) systems.

It has been discovered that on certain model year 2023 Gemini & Compass the solar panels were not properly installed. As a result, the solar panel could become loose or detach from the roof. This could lead to property damage and/or personal injury or become a road hazard and increase the risk of a crash.

The Advance Dealer Notice is to notify the dealers of a safety defect relating to the piston oil ring in certain 2021-2023 MY Soul and Seltos vehicles, the details of the recall campaign, planned repair availability and planned owner notification schedule, and to remind them that it is a violation of Federal law for them to sell or lease a vehicle covered by the notification until the recall has been performed on the vehicle.

Nova Bus (US) Inc. has decided that certain Nova Bus model LFS and Model Years 2006 to 2007 manufactured from September 2006 to June 2007 equipped with a configuration of 40 seats or more with an incorrect amount of emergency exit fail to conform to Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard No. 217; Bus emergency exits and window retention and release. 

The affected vehicles may have been manufactured with an incorrect amount of emergency exits to meet the requirements of FMVSS 217. While exceeding the unobstructed opening surface required, the impacted vehicle do not provide at least 40% of the required area on each side of the bus. During an emergency, a non-compliance to FMVSS 217 may increase the time required to exit the bus, therefore increasing the risk of injury. 

The service document explaining the measures to be taken to remedy the affected vehicles will be published on Nova Bus web site. However, the corrective measure is not yet finalized. We will notify you again when the remedy is ready.

Certain Volvo, New VN model vehicles do not meet minimum brake actuation timing requirements from FMVSS 121 (S5.5.5.1), which could cause a delay in brake activation and increase stopping distances. This could increase the risk of a crash causing injury and/or damage to property.

Genesis Motor America (GMA) has noted some retailers are having issues downloading Event 1197 for Recall 026G. This issue has now been resolved, and Event 1197 can now be downloaded and loaded onto GDS Smart application.

Certain 20232024MY G80 (RG3), GV80 (JX1), 20232025MY GV70 Electrified (JK1A EV), and 2025MY GV70 (JK1/JK1A) vehicles' instrument panel (IP) cluster display(s) may be inoperative or exhibit intermittent performance with partial/flickering image display due to erroneous software logic upon vehicle start up. In their failed state, the vehicles being recalled do not meet certain requirements set forth in Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard No. 101, Controls and Displays." An inoperative or degraded IP cluster image could mask essential gauges, such as the speedometer, fuel gauge, and certain on-screen notifications associated with motive powertrain, and increase the risk of a crash.

Genesis Motor America (GMA) has noted some retailers were having issues completing Events 1196, 1197, and 1218. The issues have now been resolved, however there may be additional steps needed for these resolutions to take effect.

Certain 20232024MY G80 (RG3), GV80 (JX1), 20232025MY GV70 Electrified (JK1A EV), and 2025MY GV70 (JK1/JK1A) vehicles' instrument panel (IP) cluster display(s) may be inoperative or exhibit intermittent performance with partial/flickering image display due to erroneous software logic upon vehicle start up. In their failed state, the vehicles being recalled do not meet certain requirements set forth in Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard No. 101, Controls and Displays." An inoperative or degraded IP cluster image could mask essential gauges, such as the speedometer, fuel gauge, and certain on-screen notifications associated with motive powertrain, and increase the risk of a crash.
This bulletin provides instructions to update the instrument panel (IP) cluster display software.

Genesis Motor America (GMA) has noted some retailers are having issues with GDS Smart application not recognizing Event 1218 as available for Recall 026G.

Due to a manufacturing defect, fasteners securing the gear change arm may loosen and separate from the stroke sensor assembly. If the gear change arm separates from the stroke sensor assembly, the rider will be unable to shift gears while riding, increasing the risk of a crash or injury.

Remedy Instructions and TSB

Repair instructions within letter for advisory 25-462. It has been decided that the vehicles in the recall population may have been manufactured with a side window that is identified with an exit sticker. The side window exit handles may be blocked by the valance. These units have an exit window in the rear of the unit therefore the side window does not need to be an exit window. If an emergency situation arises and the occupants of the vehicle attempt to use the side window as an emergency exit point, they will not be able to exit as the valance blocks the handle for the emergency egress point resulting in an increased risk of personal injury.

OWNER LETTER FOR RECALL 25V113

Owner Letter notifies the customer of the safety recall campaign relating to the rear gear drive unit (GDU) what the concern is, what Kia will do, and what the customer should do when they receive the notice. It will also advise them of the steps to take to submit documents for review of possible reimbursement if they have had previous repairs for the recalled part.

The Dealer Principal letter is to notify the dealer principal of a safety defect relating to the rear gear drive unit in certain 2025 MY EV9 vehicles, the details of the recall campaign, owner notification schedule, and to remind them that it is a violation of Federal law for them to sell or lease a vehicle covered by the notification until the recall has been performed on the vehicle.

The Dealer Parts & Service Manager letter is to notify the dealer of a safety defect relating to the rear gear drive unit in certain 2025 MY EV9 vehicles,  the details of the recall campaign, owner notification schedule, and to remind them that it is a violation of Federal law for them to sell or lease a vehicle covered by the notification until the recall has been performed on the vehicle.
The Q&A contains questions and answers regarding the rear gear drive unit in certain 2025 MY EV9 vehicles.
The Technical Service Bulletin (TSB) lists specific repair instructions relating to the Rear Motor and Reduction Gear Drive Assembly Replacement.

On certain model year 2025 Grand Design Serenova Travel Trailers
manufactured between September 25, 2024 and January 29, 2025, the
recalled products have over torqued castle nut(s) on the axle spindle(s)

On certain model year 2025 Grand Design Serenova Travel Trailers
manufactured between September 25, 2024 and January 29, 2025, the
recalled products have over torqued castle nut(s) on the axle spindle(s)

The defect involves an over torqued castle nut on the axle spindle assembly.
An over torqued castle nut can bind the wheel bearings, leading to excessive
heat. On over heated wheel bearing can lead to loose wheel(s), wheel off and
even fire.

Safety Recall 25S17

Image Processing Module Reprogramming

Motiv Power Systems, Inc. has determined that on certain vehicles converted to a Motiv electric powertrain, a Throttle Position Sensor (TPS) power wire connector pin at the Powertrain Control Module (PCM) connector could loosen over time, potentially resulting in loss of connection and loss of TPS signal to the PCM. This, in turn could result in a loss of vehicle propulsion. To ensure that these vehicles meet Motivs stringent quality requirements, follow the instructions outlined below to inspect all potentially affected vehicles and correct or replace any 12-volt control wires showing signs of fatigue, cracking, or improper retention or protection.

To ensure that these vehicles meet Motivs stringent quality requirements, follow the instructions outlined below to inspect all potentially affected vehicles and correct or replace any 12-volt control wires showing signs of fatigue, cracking, or improper retention or protection.

Interim customer notification ( mailed proof)  for recall IARCM004189 describing door button mechanism issue and current state of the remedy.

Workshop instruction V2. An issue has been identified on affected vehicles where the door button can become stuck in the 
depressed position.

This is a Dealer Stop Delivery Notification Regarding Campaign IARCM004189

NEOS has identified a safety related defect relating to door button mechanisms affecting vehicles covered by this notice. In a proportion of affected vehicles, the door button mechanism may have been assembled without a sufficient application of grease. This may allow the exterior door buttons to remain in the depressed position and prevent the door from fully latching. 

If the door does not latch, it may open while the vehicle is in motion, increasing the risk of injury to passengers inside the vehicle.

***** Campaign Summary *****
Nissan will notify the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) that it is issuing a Voluntary Safety Recall Campaign on certain model year 2025 Nissan Sentra vehicles identified in Service Comm and DBS National Service History.
On affected vehicles, potential improper weld penetration between the lower seat frame and bracket may result in excessive free play movement of the drivers seat and may not meet the requirements of FMVSS 207 S4.2.1 Seat Adjustment, FMVSS 207 S4.3.2 Performance of Restraining Device, and FMVSS 210 S5.1 Seats with Type 1 or Type 2 Seat Belt Assemblies.
The Nissan dealer will inspect the driver seat track and, if necessary, replace the lower seat frame assembly.

VOLUNTARY SAFETY RECALL CAMPAIGN
2025 SENTRA; DRIVER SEAT TRACK INSPECTION
INTRODUCTION
Nissan is conducting this voluntary safety recall campaign on certain specific model year
2025 Sentra vehicles to inspect the driver seat track. This service will be performed at no
charge to the customer for parts or labor.
IDENTIFICATION NUMBER
Nissan has assigned identification number PMA45 to this campaign. This number must
appear on all communication and documentation of any nature dealing with this campaign.
DEALER RESPONSIBILITY
It is the dealers responsibility to check Service COMM or Dealer Business Systems (DBS)
National Service History for the campaign status on each vehicle falling within the range of
this voluntary safety recall which for any reason enters the service department. This
includes vehicles purchased from private parties or presented by transient (tourist) owners
and vehicles in a dealers inventory. Federal law requires that new vehicles in dealer
inventory which are the subject of a safety recall must be corrected prior to sale.
Failure to do so can result in civil penalties by the National Highway Traffic Safety
Administration. While federal law applies only to new vehicles, Nissan strongly
encourages dealers to correct any used vehicles in their inventory before they are retailed.

This notice is sent to you in accordance with the National Traffic and Motor Vehicle Safety Act.
Mazda Motor Corporation has decided that a defect which relates to motor vehicle safety exists in certain 2024-2025MY CX-50 vehicles produced from February 29, 2024 through December 10, 2024. If you receive this notice, your vehicle is included in this recall.

What is the problem?
Over time and continuous use, the trailer hitch assembly bolts may loosen due to improper torque (tightening) during installation, potentially causing the assembly to separate from the vehicle body during towing or normal driving conditions. If the fastening bolts are not sufficiently tightened, they may fail to secure the trailer hitch assembly properly, resulting in it becoming loose or detached. A detached trailer hitch assembly may pose a road hazard and increases the risk of a crash.

VOLUNTARY SAFETY RECALL CAMPAIGN
2025 QX60; FRONT BRAKE CALIPER INSPECTION
INTRODUCTION
Infiniti is conducting this voluntary safety recall campaign on certain specific model year
2025 QX60 vehicles to inspect and, if necessary, replace the front brake calipers. This
service will be performed at no charge to the client for parts or labor.
IDENTIFICATION NUMBER
Infiniti has assigned identification number PD138 to this campaign. This number must
appear on all communication and documentation of any nature dealing with this campaign.
RETAILER RESPONSIBILITY
It is the retailers responsibility to check Service COMM or Dealer Business Systems (DBS)
National Service History for the campaign status on each vehicle falling within the range of
this voluntary safety recall which for any reason enters the service department. This
includes vehicles purchased from private parties or presented by transient (tourist) clients
and vehicles in a retailers inventory. Federal law requires that new vehicles in retailer
inventory which are the subject of a safety recall must be corrected prior to sale.
Failure to do so can result in civil penalties by the National Highway Traffic Safety
Administration. While federal law applies only to new vehicles, Infiniti strongly
encourages retailers to correct any used vehicles in their inventory before they are retailed.

***** Campaign Summary *****
INFINITI is committed to the safety and security of our clients and their passengers. INFINITI has notified the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) that it is issuing Voluntary Safety Recall Campaigns on certain model year 2025 INFINITI QX60 vehicles identified in Service Comm and DBS National Service History.
On affected vehicles, one or both front brake calipers may have reduced strength and could potentially break. If either of the front brake calipers fail and separate from the front brake assembly, it can result in reduced braking performance. If this occurs, the condition may not be compliant with certain performance requirements of FMVSS 135 Light vehicle brake systems.
Retailers will inspect both front brake calipers by lot code. If the lot code is determined to be suspect, the affected front brake caliper(s) will be replaced with a new one.

***** Campaign Summary *****
Nissan is committed to the safety and security of our customers and passengers. Nissan has notified the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) that it is conducting a Voluntary Safety Recall Campaign on certain model year 2025 Nissan Pathfinder and Murano vehicles identified in Service Comm and DBS National Service History.
On affected vehicles, one or both front brake calipers may have reduced strength and could potentially break. If either of the front brake calipers fail and separate from the front brake assembly, it can result in reduced braking performance. If this occurs, the condition may not be compliant with certain performance requirements of FMVSS 135 Light vehicle brake systems.
Dealers will inspect both front brake calipers by lot code. If the lot code is determined to be suspect, the affected front brake caliper(s) will be replaced with a new one.

Campaign Summary:                                                                                                     
  
Nissan is committed to the safety and security of our customers and passengers. Nissan has notified the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) that it is conducting a Voluntary Safety Recall Campaign on certain model year 2025 Nissan Kicks vehicles identified in Service Comm and DBS National Service History.
On affected vehicles, the Certification Label may have been printed with the incorrect Gross Vehicle Weight Rating (GVWR) and Gross Axle Weight Rating (GAWR) values. To remedy a potential noncompliance with US regulation CFR 49 Part 567.4, corrected labels have been created for installation on affected vehicles.
Dealers will receive a VIN list for the affected inventory vehicles. Additionally, dealers will receive the corrected certification labels via UPS for each vehicle in dealer inventory the week of March 31, 2025.
Owners of potentially affected retailed vehicles will receive corrected certification labels in May, 2025, along with instructions on how to install the new label. Alternatively, owners can take the corrected certification label to any Nissan dealer of their choice to have the remedy completed.

***** Campaign Summary *****
Nissan is committed to the safety and security of our customers and passengers. Nissan has notified the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) that it is conducting a Voluntary Safety Recall Campaign on certain model year 2025 Nissan Kicks SR trim vehicles identified in Service Comm and DBS National Service History.
For affected vehicles, the Certification Label might display incorrect values for Gross Vehicle Weight Rating (GVWR), Gross Axle Weight Rating (GAWR), and/or tire/wheel specifications. This discrepancy could result in noncompliance with US regulation CFR 49 Part 567.4.
The remedy instruction will be published no later than April 25th. Before the end of April, via UPS, dealers will receive a VIN list and corrected certification labels for each vehicle in dealer inventory.
Owners of potentially affected retailed vehicles will receive corrected certification labels in May 2025, along with instructions on how to install the new label. Alternatively, owners can take the corrected certification label to any Nissan dealer of their choice to have the remedy completed.
***** What Dealers Should Do****
1. Verify if vehicles are affected by this voluntary safety recall using Service Comm or DBS National Service History  Open Campaigns I.D. PMA47
 New vehicles in dealer inventory can also be identified using DBS (Sales-> Vehicle Inventory, and filter by Open Campaign).
*  Refer to NPSB 15-460 for additional information

REVISION 2
Please discard earlier versions of this bulletin.
The announcement from April 9, 2025, has been revised to include the following:
 All SR trim vehicles remaining in dealer inventory affected by this voluntary recall are being closed under campaign ID PD136 and moved to campaign ID PMA47.
 Dealers can continue to apply the corrected Certification Label for S and SV trim levels affected by this voluntary recall
 Using the pre-paid envelope provided, please return any SR trim labels in addition to those for vehicles no longer in your inventory.

VOLUNTARY RECALL CAMPAIGN 2025 KICKS; CERTIFICATION LABEL
INTRODUCTION
Nissan is conducting this voluntary recall campaign on certain specific model year 2025 Kicks vehicles that the Certification Label may have potentially been printed with the incorrect Gross Vehicle Weight Rating (GVWR) values. To remedy this issue, Nissan is providing customers with a new Certification Label. Customers have the option of affixing the new Certification Label or going to a Nissan dealership to have the new label affixed at no charge for parts or labor.
IDENTIFICATION NUMBER
Nissan has assigned identification number PD136 to this campaign. This number must appear on all communication and documentation of any nature dealing with this campaign.
DEALER RESPONSIBILITY
It is the dealers responsibility to check Service COMM or Dealer Business Systems (DBS) National Service History for the campaign status on each vehicle falling within the range of this voluntary recall which for any reason enters the service department. This includes vehicles purchased from private parties or presented by transient (tourist) owners and vehicles in a dealers inventory. Federal law requires that new vehicles in dealer inventory which are the subject of a recall must be corrected prior to sale. Failure to do so can result in civil penalties by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration. While federal law applies only to new vehicles, Nissan strongly encourages dealers to correct any used vehicles in their inventory before they are retailed.

Honda is issuing a STOP SALE NOTICE on CERTAIN 2024 and 2025 ADV160 scooters to inspect the engines oil pump driven gear for abnormal wear and noise .
Due to a manufacturing defect, the gear may wear prematurely causing an inadequate oil supply to the engine. If the scooter continues to operate with low oil pressure, the
engine can eventually seize, causing the rear wheel to lock up and decelerate while riding, potentially increasing the risk of a crash or injury.
Due to a manufacturing defect, the gear may wear prematurely causing an inadequate oil supply to the engine.

American Honda notified NHTSA of a stop sale and safety recall for certain 2018-2024 CB300R motorcycles to resolve an issue with the headlight. In certain situations, the headlight may flicker or become inoperable.

due to a manufacturing defect, the headlights internal circuitry may become damaged due to the road and engine vibrations experienced during normal operation. The headlight may begin to flicker and may eventually shut off. If the headlight does not remain on during normal operation, it can reduce the rider's visibility at night, prevent other traffic from seeing the motorcycle, and not comply with traffic laws requiring a motorcycle's headlight to remain on at all times, potentially increasing the risk of a crash or injury.

Due to a manufacturing defect, the headlight's internal circuitry may become damaged due to road and engine vibrations experienced during normal vehicle operation. The headlight may begin to flicker and eventually shut off, potentially increasing the risk of a crash or injury.

During assembly, the front stabilizer bar right side mounting bolts may have been improperly torqued. An improperly torqued mounting bolt may cause the stabilizer bar to separate and over time, loosen and fall out, allowing damage to the high voltage cables and EV battery coolant lines, rendering the vehicle undriveable and increasing the risk of a crash or injury.

During assembly, the front stabilizer bar right side mounting bolts may have been improperly torqued. An improperly torqued mounting bolt may cause the stabilizer bar to separate and over time, loosen and fall out, allowing damage to the high voltage cables and EV battery coolant lines, rendering the vehicle undriveable and increasing the risk of a crash or injury.

The subject vehicles are equipped with a Left-Foot Braking (LFB) feature designed for use on performance roadways, such as racetracks. LFB allows operators to control vehicle speed through simultaneous operation of the accelerator and brake pedals. During certain driving maneuvers with LFB engaged, the Integrated Electronic Brake (IEB) control software may initiate depressurization of the ABS system, resulting in reduced braking performance. Separately, the Vehicle Control Unit (VCU) software may cause a momentary continued acceleration during release of the accelerator pedal if the vehicles N e-Shift feature is engaged.
Reduced braking performance could lead to longer stopping distances than anticipated by the operator, increasing the risk of a crash. Momentary continued acceleration could increase the risk of a crash.

Certain 2025MY IONIQ 5 N (NE EV N) vehicles are equipped with a Left-Foot Braking (LFB) feature designed for use on performance roadways, such as racetracks. LFB allows operators to control vehicle speed through simultaneous operation of the accelerator and brake pedals. During certain driving maneuvers with LFB engaged, the Integrated Electronic Brake (IEB) control software may initiate depressurization of the ABS system, resulting in reduced braking performance. Separately, the Vehicle Control Unit (VCU) software may cause a momentary continued acceleration during release of the accelerator pedal if the vehicles N e-Shift feature is engaged. Reduced braking performance could lead to longer stopping distances than anticipated by the operator, increasing the risk of a crash. Momentary continued acceleration could increase the risk of a crash.
Follow the procedure in this TSB to inspect the software version for the IEB and update if necessary. All impacted vehicles will require the VCU software update.

The subject vehicles are equipped with a LFB feature designed for use on performance roadways, such as racetracks. LFB allows operators to control vehicle speed through simultaneous operation of the accelerator and brake pedals. When the LFB is engaged, the IEB control software may trigger depressurization of the Anti-Lock Brake System (ABS) pump, resulting in reduced braking performance. Separately, the VCU software may cause an unexpected, continued acceleration during the release of the accelerator pedal when the vehicles N e-Shift feature is engaged. Reduced braking performance could lead to longer stopping distances, increasing the risk of a crash. Unexpected, continued acceleration could increase the risk of a crash.

Certain 2025MY IONIQ 5 N (NE EV N) vehicles are equipped with a Left-Foot Braking (LFB) feature designed for use on performance roadways, such as racetracks. LFB allows operators to control vehicle speed through simultaneous operation of the accelerator and brake pedals. During certain driving maneuvers with LFB engaged, the Integrated Electronic Brake (IEB) control software may initiate depressurization of the ABS system, resulting in reduced braking performance. Separately, the Vehicle Control Unit (VCU) software may cause a momentary continued acceleration during release of the accelerator pedal if the vehicles N e-Shift feature is engaged.
Reduced braking performance could lead to longer stopping distances than anticipated by the operator, increasing the risk of a crash. Momentary continued acceleration could increase the risk of a crash.
